# Locating PDF template for vscode-pandoc (2025-08-17 14:41Z)

_**User (2025-08-29 10:15Z)**_

where is the pdf template used by vscode-pandoc 

---

_**Agent (model copilot/gpt-4.1)**_

The PDF template used by vscode-pandoc is typically determined by the Pandoc configuration and command-line options. By default, Pandoc uses its built-in LaTeX template (e.g., eisvogel, default.latex, or any custom template you specify).

If you do not specify a template, Pandoc uses its default template, which is bundled with Pandoc itself (not with VS Code). You can specify a custom template in your Pandoc command or settings using the --template option, like this:

pandoc input.md -o output.pdf --template=mytemplate.latex

To find or customize the template:
- The default template can be viewed with: pandoc -D latex > default.latex
- Custom templates can be placed anywhere and referenced with the --template option.
- vscode-pandoc itself does not provide or store templates; it just calls Pandoc.

If you want to know which template is being used, check your Pandoc command or the extension settings in VS Code for any --template argument. Otherwise, it uses Pandoc’s built-in default.

---

_**User (2025-08-29 10:17Z)**_

in this pdf.tex what is the base font size?

---

_**Agent (model copilot/gpt-4.1)**_

In your `pdf.tex` template, the base font size is determined by the $fontsize$ variable, which is set via Pandoc’s command line or metadata. If $fontsize$ is not specified, LaTeX’s default is 10pt. So, unless you set $fontsize$ elsewhere, the base font size will be 10pt.

---

_**User (2025-08-29 10:17Z)**_

check the open document for font size

---

_**Agent (model copilot/gpt-4.1)**_

In the open `pdf.tex` document, the font size is set by the $fontsize$ variable in the \documentclass options:

```tex
$if(fontsize)$
	$fontsize$,
$endif$
```

This means the font size is not hardcoded in the template. If you do not specify a font size in your Pandoc command or metadata, LaTeX defaults to 10pt. If you want a different size (e.g., 11pt or 12pt), you must set $fontsize$ in your document’s metadata or Pandoc command.

---

_**User (2025-08-29 10:18Z)**_

set the font size to 12

---

_**Agent (model copilot/gpt-4.1)**_

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="copilot_insertEdit">
<details>
<summary>Tool use: **copilot_insertEdit** • Edit file: g:\Dropbox (Personal)\JD\40-49 tech\software\VS Code\76.07 VS Code Pandoc\pdf.tex</summary>

The base font size is now set to 12pt in your  template.```latex
% Remove or comment out the \raggedright directive to allow justified text (just add or remove the `%` character at the start of the next line)
\raggedright	% Apply left-justified text throughout the document
$passoptions.latex()$
\documentclass[
12pt,
$if(papersize)$
	$papersize$paper,
$endif$
$for(classoption)$
	$classoption$$sep$,
$endfor$
]{$documentclass$}
$after-header-includes.latex()$
$if(beamerarticle)$
\usepackage{beamerarticle} % needs to be loaded first
$endif$
\usepackage[none]{hyphenat}
\usepackage{xcolor}
% Remove or comment out the parskip package
% \usepackage{parskip} % Treats line breaks as paragraph breaks
$if(geometry)$
\usepackage[$for(geometry)$$geometry$$sep$,$endfor$]{geometry}
$else$
% Set custom margins if no geometry settings are provided
\usepackage[margin=2.5cm]{geometry}
$endif$
\usepackage{amsmath,amssymb}
\usepackage{booktabs} % Better tables
\usepackage{graphicx} % For images
% Adaptive font configuration based on engine
\makeatletter
\@ifundefined{XeTeXversion}{%
	\@ifundefined{luatexversion}{%
		% pdfLaTeX setup
		\usepackage[T1]{fontenc}
		\usepackage{lmodern}
	}{%
		% LuaLaTeX setup
		\usepackage{fontspec}
		 \setmainfont{Aptos}[BoldFont = Aptos Bold,ItalicFont = Aptos Italic,BoldItalicFont = Aptos Bold Italic]
	}
}{%
	% XeLaTeX setup
	\usepackage{fontspec}
	\setmainfont{Aptos}[BoldFont = Aptos Bold,ItalicFont = Aptos Italic,BoldItalicFont = Aptos Bold Italic]
}
\makeatother
$common.latex()$
$for(header-includes)$
$header-includes$
$endfor$
$after-header-includes.latex()$
$hypersetup.latex()$
\hypersetup{colorlinks=true, linkcolor=blue, urlcolor=blue, citecolor=blue}
% Traditional paragraph formatting setup
\setlength{\parindent}{1em} % Set paragraph indentation
\setlength{\parskip}{0pt}	 % No extra space between paragraphs
% Custom environment for adding space AND removing indent
\newenvironment{spacednoindent}{%
	\par\vspace{\baselineskip}\noindent%
}{%
	\par%
}
% Custom environment for adding space when needed
\newenvironment{spacedpar}{\par\vspace{\baselineskip}}{\par}
% Command to add vertical space manually
\newcommand{\extraspace}{\vspace{\baselineskip}}
$if(title)$
\title{$title$$if(thanks)$\thanks{$thanks$}$endif$}
$endif$
$if(subtitle)$
\usepackage{etoolbox}
\makeatletter
\providecommand{\subtitle}[1]{% add subtitle to \maketitle
	\apptocmd{\@title}{\par {\large #1 \par}}{}{%
		\errmessage{Failed to patch \@title with subtitle}%
	}%
}
\makeatother
\subtitle{$subtitle$}
$endif$
\author{$for(author)$$author$$sep$ \and $endfor$}
\date{$date$}
\begin{document}
$if(has-frontmatter)$
\frontmatter
$endif$
$if(title)$
\maketitle
$if(abstract)$
\begin{abstract}
$abstract$
\end{abstract}
$endif$
$endif$
$for(include-before)$
$include-before$
$endfor$
$if(toc)$
$if(toc-title)$
\renewcommand*\contentsname{$toc-title$}
$endif$
{
$if(colorlinks)$
\hypersetup{linkcolor=$if(toccolor)$$toccolor$$else$$endif$}
$endif$
\setcounter{tocdepth}{$toc-depth$}
\tableofcontents
}
$endif$
$if(lof)$
\listoffigures
$endif$
$if(lot)$
\listoftables
$endif$
$if(linestretch)$
\setstretch{$linestretch$}
$endif$
$if(has-frontmatter)$
\mainmatter
$endif$
\setcounter{secnumdepth}{0} % Prevent numbering of section headings
$body$
$if(has-frontmatter)$
\backmatter
$endif$
$if(nocite-ids)$
\nocite{$for(nocite-ids)$$it$$sep$, $endfor$}
$endif$
$if(natbib)$
$if(bibliography)$
$if(biblio-title)$
$if(has-chapters)$
\renewcommand\bibname{$biblio-title$}
$else$
\renewcommand\refname{$biblio-title$}
$endif$
$endif$
\bibliography{$for(bibliography)$$bibliography$$sep$,$endfor$}
$endif$
$endif$
$if(biblatex)$
\printbibliography$if(biblio-title)$[title=$biblio-title$]$endif$
$endif$
$for(include-after)$
$include-after$
$endfor$
\end{document}
```


</details>
</tool-use>
